articles.description: Amateur astronomer Gennady Borisov was the first person to identify a new comet in August of 2019. Researchers reported on Monday that gas coming off the comet, 2I/Borisov, had high levels of carbon monoxide - far more than comets formed in our solar system.
articles.content:
Scientists recently reported new details about the second interstellar object ever seen passing through our solar system. It is a comet called 2I/Borisov.
Comets are made up of frozen gases, rock and dust that orbit stars. The Reuters news agency likens them… [+3202 chars]

articles.author: Callum Hoare
articles.title: Moon landing: How Buzz Aldrin’s gaffe settled secret bet between Armstrong and Collins - Express.co.uk
articles.description: MICHAEL COLLINS made a secret bet with his colleague Neil Armstrong over their return to Earth from the Apollo 11 mission and a mistake made by Buzz Aldrin would prove key for the winner.

articles.title: NASA's Perseverance rover is perfectly balanced for its trip to Mars - Brinkwire
articles.content:
NASAs Perseverance rover is preparing for launch in the next few months by undergoing final checks, and it has just made it through one more item on the list: Ensuring that it is correctly balanced.

articles.description: The Hubble Space Telescope was launched into orbit aboard the Space Shuttle Discovery on April 24, 1990. Hubble's orbit outside of the Earth's atmosphere allows it to photograph extremely high-resolution

articles.title: Scientists identify the 'most dangerous place' in the history of earth, once home to fearsome predators - International Business Times, Singapore Edition

articles.description: Move over, Animal Crossing.

articles.description: The June solstice is June 20. Longest day for the Northern Hemisphere. Shortest day for the Southern Hemisphere. Details here.
